scenes.background: [Monica] looks relieved but [Bob] still seems agitated, tapping his foot.
scenes.description: 'Thanks for your input. So, should we schedule another meeting to go over the details?'

options.text: I think that's a good idea. Let's make sure we have all the necessary information first.
options.analysis: You supported the idea of another meeting with a focus on preparation, showing good perception and self-regulation, but the emotional impact on others was not deeply addressed.

options.text: Monica, maybe you can outline what needs to be addressed before we meet again.
options.analysis: You directed the task of outlining details to Monica, showing empathy and social skills, but your perception of the broader problem could be stronger.

options.text: Bob, do you think a meeting will resolve this, or should we take a different approach?
options.analysis: You asked for Bob's opinion, showing good social skill, but your empathy and motivation to immediately resolve the issue were lower.
